column4: I see. On this client I can enter  /server irc.freenode.net     and log in here.

I see. I was trying to make it a bit easier for people that I want to log into my server once set up. I also would like to set up chat web pages where others can talk in real time. I suppose a DNS daemon may help there too.
I think I get the idea Wulfy. Thanks.
no you would use ip:6667 (unless you was using dyndns etc
you could tell your router to give your server a perminant internal ip
and then once you have setup a static ip for your server (via the router) you would then do port forwarding 80 and what ever other ports you wanted operning
yes your external ip may be dynamic but if you tell your router to "save" the internal ip your server has now you can then setup port forwarding to that ip as your internal ip shouldnt change
affraid.org isnt any differnt in ease of use with regards to setup/use and most routers support it as much as dyndns
would I need to do the same with the router if I wanted to set up a private IRC daemon set up a STATIC address for the same server and asign a port number?
you would use the same internal ip and simpley port forward to the irc dameon port so you would open 80,6667 (for example)
so I would enter   server.28.222.15.21:6667    just as an example?
no unless you have a domain name such as one from dyndns you cant use server.ip.net:portnumber you have to use ip:port

that is because the domain irc.freenode.net translates into a ip as they have domain records set for it once you get a domaion name from afraid.org or dyndns you can then setup A records for your ip which will then translate into domain name > ip
can you please add my name to your messages so i can track them, and  yes as your WAN ip will change every now and then it is best to setup a dyndns account
